thread.title: Location, Location, Location is coming to Exeter | Devon Live
thread.title_full: Location, Location, Location is coming to Exeter | Devon Live

author: Devon Live
title: Location, Location, Location is coming to Exeter | Devon Live
text:
Location, Location, Location is coming to Exeter By Devon Live | Posted: March 29, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp Location, Location, Location is coming to Exeter X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
People searching for their perfect home in Devon are being sought for the next series of Location, Location, Location. Presented by Broadhembury resident Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer, the popular property programme is looking for those who are buying near Exeter. 
The county is a property hotspot – with percentage price rises outstripping almost everywhere in the country. The average house price in Devon rose 5.3 per cent in the year to January, to an average of £245,492. According to the Office for National Statistics' house price index, this puts prices at their highest level since records began in 1995. 
House prices in East Devon are also at their highest level ever, up 8.4 per cent to £272,733, as are price in Mid Devon, up 7.1 per cent to £220,552. The average UK house price was £218,000 in January 2017. This is £13,000 higher than in January 2016 and £1,000 higher than last month. The average price of a semi-detached home in Exeter is now £218,757. Just 17 years ago, at the turn of the century, it was just £101,090. Property Search Find an Agent GO 
The main contribution to the increase in UK house prices came from England, where house prices increased by 6.5 per cent over the year to January 2017, with the average price in England now £235,000. Wales saw house prices increase by 4.2 per cent over the last 12 months to stand at £146,000. In Scotland, the average price increased by 4.0 per cent over the year to stand at £142,000. The average price in Northern Ireland currently stands at £125,000, an increase of 5.7 per cent over the last 12 months. 
Read more: Sausage maker eyes post-Brexit sales opportunities 
On a regional basis, London continues to be the region with the highest average house price at £491,000, followed by the South East and the East of England, which stand at £319,000 and £279,000 respectively. The lowest average price continues to be in the North East at £124,000. 
The East of England is the region which showed the highest annual growth, with prices increasing by 9.4% in the year to January 2017. 
Growth in the South East was second highest at 8.7 per cent, followed by London at 7.3 per cent. The lowest annual growth was in the North East, where prices increased by 2.2 per cent over the year. 
Read more: Is this the fastest girl in football history? 
Location, Location, Location programme makers IWC say they want to hear from anyone having trouble finding the right property to get in touch so Phil and Kirstie can help them find their dream home. They are working with Fraser and Wheeler Estate Agents in Exeter. For more information call 01329 420410.
